results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Balloons (Aeronautics);Wang Yi;China;Russia;Ukraine;United States
results.title: China Says U.S. Is ‘Not Qualified’ to Issue Orders on Arms
results.abstract: Beijing is trying to preserve ties with Moscow while asserting it is a neutral observer trying only to coax Russia and Ukraine into peace talks.

media.caption: Tanks congregating on the road in a village near the frontline in Eastern Ukraine this month.
media.copyright: Lynsey Addario for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Parades;Mardi Gras;Mass Shootings;Police Department (New Orleans, La);New Orleans (La)
results.title: 1 Dead, 4 Wounded in Shooting at New Orleans Parade Ahead of Mardi Gras
results.abstract: The victims, one of whom was a 4-year-old girl, were shot at the Krewe of Bacchus Parade on Sunday night. One person was detained at the scene, the police said.

media.caption: The Krewe of Bacchus Parade was halted after a shooting along its route in New Orleans on Sunday night.

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Priests;O'Connell, David (1953-2023);Medina, Carlos;Roman Catholic Church;Los Angeles (Calif);Los Angeles County (Calif);County Cork (Ireland);Hacienda Heights (Calif.)
results.byline: By Michael Levenson and Christine Chung
results.title: Man Arrested in Killing of Auxiliary Bishop Had Worked at His House
results.abstract: David G. O’Connell, a Roman Catholic bishop, was shot in his home in Hacienda Heights, Calif., on Saturday. The authorities said the man in custody was the husband of the bishop’s housekeeper.

media.caption: David O’Connell, an auxiliary bishop in the Archdiocese of Los Angeles, leading a memorial service in 2020. He was fatally shot in his home on Saturday.

results.adx_keywords: Police;Missing Persons;Bulley, Nicola;England;Great Britain;St Michael's on Wyre (England)
results.byline: By Isabella Kwai and Emma Bubola
results.title: Police Identify Body in River as That of Missing British Woman
results.abstract: The disappearance of Nicola Bulley, a 45-year-old mortgage adviser and mother of two, prompted a national debate over privacy and the treatment of missing women.

media.caption: The River Wyre in Lancashire, England, where the body of Nicola Bulley was recovered on Sunday.

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Mandatory Sentencing;Baldwin, Alec;Gutierrez-Reed, Hannah;Santa Fe (NM)
results.title: ‘Rust’ Prosecutors Downgrade Alec Baldwin’s Manslaughter Charges
results.abstract: The actor’s lawyers had argued that a firearm law included by the prosecutors was not in effect at the time of the fatal shooting. It would have carried a mandatory five-year sentence.

media.caption: If convicted of involuntary manslaughter, Alec Baldwin and Hannah Gutierrez-Reed, the film’s armorer, would now face up to 18 months in prison.

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Belzer, Richard
results.title: Richard Belzer, Detective Munch on ‘Law & Order: S.V.U.,’ Dies at 78
results.abstract: A stand-up comic, he called his hard-boiled character on the long-running TV drama “Lenny Bruce with a badge.”

media.caption: Richard Belzer with Mariska Hargitay in “Law & Order: Special Victims Unit” in 2003. His character, Detective John Munch, appeared on 10 different TV shows.
media.copyright: Will Hart/NBCU Photo Bank/NBCUniversal, via Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Defense and Military Forces;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Funerals and Memorials;Civilian Casualties;Deaths (Fatalities);Ukraine
results.byline: By Jeffrey Gettleman and Ivor Prickett
results.title: They Were Married. They Shared a Trench. They Died in It Together.
results.abstract: Taras and Olha Melster signed up to help the war effort. Like many other urban professionals in Ukraine, they never expected to be sent to the front line.

media.caption: Yurii Melster visiting the graves of his son, Taras, and daughter-in-law, Olha, in the military section of a cemetery in Kropyvnytskyi, Ukraine, in February.

results.adx_keywords: Mass Shootings;Live Lounge (Memphis, Tenn);Memphis (Tenn)
results.title: One Dead and 10 Wounded in Memphis Shooting, Officials Say
results.abstract: Eleven people were shot early on Sunday, leaving one person dead and five critically wounded, the police said. It was unclear what led to the gunfire.

media.caption: Live Lounge was one of two scenes of a mass shooting in Memphis that left one person dead and 10 wounded on Sunday.

results.adx_keywords: Arts and Antiquities Looting;Art;Jewels and Jewelry;Kriangsak, Nawapan;Latchford, Douglas A J;Toek Tik;Metropolitan Museum of Art;Cambodia;London (England)
results.title: Cambodia Says It Has Recovered Looted Gold Jewelry Once Worn by Royals
results.abstract: The 77 items had been in the collection of Douglas A.J. Latchford, accused of trafficking in looted antiquities, and were returned under an agreement with his estate.

media.caption: Dozens of pieces of very old gold jewelry believed to have once been worn by Angkor royalty, like this diadem, have been returned to Cambodia.
media.copyright: Cambodia Ministry of Culture & Fine Arts

results.adx_keywords: Black People;Discrimination;Reparations;Eminent Domain;Land Use Policies;internal-sub-only;Bruce, Charles;Bruce, Willa;Bruce's Beach (Manhattan Beach, Calif);Los Angeles County (Calif);Manhattan Beach (Calif)
results.title: Bruce’s Beach Was Hailed as a Reparations Model. Then the Family Sold It.
results.abstract: The Bruce family won the return of oceanfront land near Los Angeles seized nearly a century ago. Their decision to sell for $20 million set off a different debate about reparations.

media.caption: Duane Shepard, a relative of the Bruce family, stands on a corner of Bruce’s Beach, overlooking the Pacific Ocean. The land was returned to the Bruce family nearly a century after it was seized by local officials.
media.copyright: Gabriella Angotti-Jones for The New York Times

results.byline: By Rob Copeland and Maureen Farrell
results.title: Hedge Fund Billionaire Extracts Billions More to Retire
results.abstract: Bridgewater’s founder, Ray Dalio, retired last year after months of negotiations that guaranteed him a gigantic exit package.

media.caption: Ray Dalio founded Bridgewater more than four decades ago. The hedge fund manages money for pensions, sovereign wealth funds and other big investors.
media.copyright: Tamir Kalifa for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Artificial Intelligence;Computers and the Internet;Search Engines;Conversation;internal-sub-only;Microsoft Corp;OpenAI Labs
results.title: A Conversation With Bing’s Chatbot Left Me Deeply Unsettled
results.abstract: A very strange conversation with the chatbot built into Microsoft’s search engine led to it declaring its love for me.

results.title: ‘Lethargic’ Alligator Rescued From Prospect Park Lake
results.abstract: The four-foot-long alligator, now being evaluated at the Bronx Zoo, is presumed to have been abandoned by someone who kept it as a pet.
org_facet: Animal Care Centers of New York City

media.caption: The alligator found in Prospect Park Lake is now being cared for at the Bronx Zoo.

results.adx_keywords: Content Type: Service;Psychology and Psychologists;Research;Conversation;Empathy;Friendship;Emotions;Anxiety and Stress
results.title: The Best Way to Comfort Someone When They’re Sad
results.abstract: A limited yet growing body of research suggests that one of the most powerful ways to support someone is also the simplest: Start a conversation.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;International Relations;Politics and Government;United States International Relations;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Biden, Joseph R Jr;Putin, Vladimir V;Zelensky, Volodymyr;Ukraine
results.byline: By Marc Santora, Peter Baker and Michael D. Shear
results.title: Biden Visits Embattled Ukraine as Air-Raid Siren Sounds
results.abstract: President Biden took a nearly 10-hour train ride from the border of Poland to show his administration’s “unwavering support” nearly a year into Russia’s invasion.

results.adx_keywords: Books and Literature;Children and Childhood;Writing and Writers;Freedom of Speech and Expression;Dahl, Roald
results.title: Roald Dahl’s Books Are Rewritten to Cut Potentially Offensive Language
results.abstract: New editions of the best-selling author’s children’s classics, including “Charlie and the Chocolate Factory,” have been altered to eliminate words deemed inappropriate. A backlash ensued.

media.caption: Roald Dahl in 1971. His children’s books have sold millions of copies.

results.adx_keywords: Monuments and Memorials (Structures);Politics and Government;International Relations;Hoxha, Enver;Albania;Tirana (Albania)
results.title: Despised Dictator’s ‘Scary’ Shrine Becomes a Bet on Albania’s Future
results.abstract: An enormous pyramid was long a reminder of a brutal regime and decades of disappointments. Now, it’s a symbol of a city aspiring to be the high-tech “Tel Aviv of the Balkans.”

media.caption: The pyramid in Tirana, Albania, was originally built as a shrine to the country’s late communist dictator, Enver Hoxha.
media.copyright: Sergey Ponomarev for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Education (K-12);Private and Sectarian Schools;Conflicts of Interest;School Boards;Jews and Judaism;Religion-State Relations;Politics and Government;Hasidism;Ethics and Official Misconduct;Petlin, Joel;Polatsek, Harry;Kepecs, Simon;Education Department (NYS);Kiryas Joel (NY);New York State
results.byline: By Jay Root and Jonah Markowitz
results.title: How Public Money Goes to Support a Hasidic Village’s Private Schools
results.abstract: Created for a New York Hasidic group in 1989, the Kiryas Joel Village Union Free School District has directed millions of dollars to the community’s network of private schools.

media.copyright: Jonah Markowitz for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Latin Music;Content Type: Personal Profile;Karol G (Singer)
results.title: Karol G’s Songs Conquered the World. On a New LP, She Reveals Herself.
results.abstract: “Mañana Será Bonito,” the Colombian pop superstar’s fourth album, traces her adventures in (and out) of love, with guests including Shakira and Romeo Santos.

media.caption: “I’m being really open with this album, and that gets me a little bit scared, because I’m not a perfect human,” Karol G said.
media.copyright: Jingyu Lin for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Movies;British Academy of Film and Television;London (England)
results.title: ‘All Quiet on the Western Front’ Wins Big at the BAFTAs
results.abstract: The German-language antiwar movie won best film, best director and five other awards at Britain’s equivalent of the Academy Awards.
org_facet: British Academy of Film and Television

media.caption: Felix Kammerer starred in the antiwar movie “All Quiet on the Western Front,” which won best film at the BAFTAs.
